FINANCE MANAGER

SUMMARY

Detailed oriented Finance Manager who is adapt at meeting dealership and customer expectations.
A proven top producer track record of at least 15 years in the automotive and F&I department.
Consistently exceed monthly goals by dealership.
Top producer in all past dealership employment, while maintaining CSI scores above company standards.
Excel at accurately and timely funding of both paper contracts and Econtracting.
Well trained in menu selling of vehicle service contracts, maintenance, and aftermarket products.
Compliant Skilled at tracking customer balances, approving loan applications, and verifying customer information.
Specialize in establishing productive relationships with customers seeking finance options.  Looking forward to harnessing all existing skills and aligning it with a company that has long term success and upward mobility.
Highlights
Solid knowledge of financing procedures and credit options within the auto industry
Ability to offer a variety of financing options to customers Adapt at effectively supervising smaller and larger staffs
Ability to establish and maintain an updated customer database Proficient at working well independently and in a team environment Extensive internal and external communication and organizational skills

ACCOMPLISHMENTS

Top Finance manager of the year for the past 2 years. 2002 salesman of the year 2003 Closer of the year, was presented with a Rolex watch Top producer from salesman to sales manager (can provide numbers for your review) Averaging $2,000 gross profit per unit sold Hit all mandatory penetrations every month.

Submit paperwork to and obtain approval from finance sources on all finance deals
Work with Sales Manager to secure a reasonable profit from every sale

Negotiate with financial institutions to get deals financed and funded

Prepare contracts and Warranty forms Facilitated DMV Paperwork

Familiar with loan structures, rates, and bank programs.

<JD_START>
Job Title: Manager Finance (open to remote EST)

Location: Pawtucket, RI

Employment Type: full-time

Listed Skills: Finance, Sales

Description:
At Hasbro, our mission is to entertain and connect generations of fans through the wonder of storytelling and exhilaration of play. We’re looking for adventurous and curious people who want to explore, experiment, and innovate to come up with the best ideas. Our culture has inspired our diverse team of highly skilled, highly creative, and highly committed individuals for 100 years and we believe the best is yet to come.

Are you ready to dive into the dynamic world of toys, licensing, and entertainment? Look no further! The Global Toy, Licensing, and Entertainment (TLE) Finance Team is on the hunt for a Finance Manager to join our ranks. As our Finance Manager, you’ll be at the heart of strategic financial decision-making. The ideal candidate will have a strong background in financial analysis, a deep understanding of financial principles, and the ability to communicate sophisticated financial information across diverse audiences. This is a highly collaborative position that will partner across functions. Your insights will shape the future of TLE. Come join our team!

A day in the life of a Finance Manager:

Your day involves a blend of analytical rigor, collaboration, and insightful communication. The core activities revolve around financial analysis, which includes tasks like conducting profitability assessments, assessing budget performance, and building sophisticated financial models.

Financial Analysis and Reporting:

Synthesize Complex Information: Gather data from various sources and distill it into clear and concise executive-level presentations, reports, and briefing documents.Perform Financial Analysis: Conduct in-depth financial assessments to inform critical business strategies. This includes analyzing profitability, optimizing costs, and projecting revenue growth.Deliver Comprehensive Financial Reports: Build and present detailed financial reports to senior management and partners. These reports will highlight trends, variances, and key performance indicators (KPIs) to inform decision-making.

Budgeting and Forecasting:

Strategic Financial Planning: Collaborate on the formulation of long-range financial strategies, encompassing aspects such as product assortment planning, pricing, and costing. Partner with the business to build financial forecasts and establish targets. Monitor progress against financial, operational, and strategic KPIs.Budget Development and Forecasting: Collaborate closely with department heads to build annual budgets and monthly forecasts. Leverage historical data, industry trends, and macroeconomic factors to inform financial planning.Budget Monitoring and Deviation Analysis: Continuously track budget performance, identifying any deviations from the planned financial targets. When discrepancies occur, recommend and implement corrective actions to ensure alignment with goals.

Data Integrity and Operational Improvement:

Maintain Data Accuracy and Integrity: Implement robust controls, perform regular reconciliations, and conduct audits to ensure the accuracy and reliability of financial data Technology and Automation: Find opportunities for improvement harnessing automation and technology to enhance efficiency and accuracy.

What you’ll bring:

Bachelor's degree in Finance, Accounting, Economics, or related field; Master's degree or professional certification (e.g., CFA, CPA) is a plus.Dynamic experience in financial analysis, with a proven track record of performing sophisticated financial modeling, analysis, and reporting while supporting cross-funcational teams (product development, marketing, sales). Consumer Product experience is absoutley required.Proficiency using data analysis tools (Excel, financial software), and familiarity with ERP systems. Knowledge of data visualization tools (Tableau, Power BI) is a plus.Meticulous attention to detail and commitment to data accuracy.Ability to thrive in a dynamic and fast-paced environment while managing competing priorities.

Hasbro is committed to equality of opportunity in all aspects of employment. We are committed to making all employment decisions without regard to race, color, religion, sex, sexual orientation, gender identity or expression, national origin, age, marital status, or any other legally protected status.

Hasbro’s world-class brands and talented people are our greatest assets. One of the ways we invest in you is through a competitive and contemporary benefits package. Your particular benefits package will depend on your position, location, local legal requirements, and years with the company. Here’s a look at what your benefits package may include: Medical, Dental & Vision Insurance, Half-day Fridays year-round, Paid Vacation Time and holidays, Generous 401(k) match, Paid Parental Leave, Team Hasbro Volunteer Program, Employee Giving and Matching Gifts Programs, Tuition Reimbursement, Toy Discounts and more!

Hasbro is committed to equality of opportunity in all aspects of employment. We are committed to making all employment decisions without regard to race, color, religion, sex, sexual orientation, gender identity or expression, national origin, age, marital status, or any other legally protected status.

Experience Level (if available): Mid-Senior level
<JD_END>
